Entries.default: [Study the machine.]
[Attempt to deactivate the machine.]
[Leave.]
You return to the control panel. It glows with a faint light as the machine hums.

You manage to make out what little of the writing hasn't faded away.

You deduce that Cignath Mór was once a place the Engwithans used to study the application of soul energy to enlarge the creatures of the Deadfire.

You also learn that the machine is funneling essence into the surrounding flora and fauna from a luminous adra pillar deep beneath the ruins.

You manage to make out what little of the writing hasn't faded away.

You deduce that Cignath Mór was once a place the Engwithans used to study the application of soul energy to enlarge the creatures of the Deadfire.

You manage to make out what little of the writing hasn't faded away.

You also learn that the machine is funneling essence into the surrounding flora and fauna from a luminous adra pillar deep beneath the ruins.
You are unable to make any sense of the humming contraption in front of you.
The machine has no apparent 'off' switch. You twist the nearest knobs and dials to see how it reacts.
"Should you want to gain my regard as well, you would destroy this place to protect my machine. "Then none will have the means to threaten my work here as you have."
"I shall obey the will of my god."
[Deactivate the machine.]
"I'll consider it."
"You need only deactivate the three pylons scattered about the ruin. That will destroy the barrier protecting this place from the sea."
"Why should I do as you ask?"
"Because I am your god, Watcher, and I reward my loyal followers."
[Deactivate the machine.]
[Leave.]
"NO!" The god Galawain cries out, but he cannot stop you.
"This lie shall be your last!"
"Decide quickly, Watcher. My creatures grow restless."
"Have you seen reason at last, Herald of Berath?"
"Is there not something requiring your attention, Watcher?"

The machine stretches from deep within the pit of water at your feet to the apex of the vaunted ceiling high above you. It emits a soft, low purr and charges the air with the same expectant frisson of energy you might feel right before a lightning strike.
"Watcher, still your hands."
"Is this machine the source of the giant coral in Sayuka's harbor?"

"Indeed it is. The Engwithans' fine creation siphons essence from a vein of adra deep within the earth, and the creatures of this region drink deeply of it. They grow strong, ruthless - and in so doing, worthy of my regard."
"Why do you protect this machine?"

"I am fond of the creatures it creates. The small among them struggle to best their bolder brethren, and some even succeed."

"But that is not what you truly want to ask, is it?"
"Uh... I'll be going now."
"Tarry a while longer, Watcher." Though Galawain's words are neutral, they seem to bind you up like vines, rooting you in place.
"How am I supposed to get out of here if it floods?"
"You survived the trial of reaching this place - surely whatever means allowed you to breathe underwater will serve you on your way back up."
"Understood."
"You know who leads the pack. Good."
"Cignath Mór is under my protection. Why do you violate it?"

As you do, a presence pushes at the edge of your mind. It soon grows forceful, overwhelming your mental barriers with ease.

The skitter and rattle of dead leaves come to you on a breeze damp with the smell of rotting wood.
Moments later, you're nearly thrown to the floor as a roar from out of nightmares shakes the ruins.
"Tarry a while longer, Watcher. It has been some seasons since we last spoke." Though Galawain's words are neutral, they seem to bind you up like vines, rooting you in place.
"Isn't that counter to your philosophy of trial, Galawain?"
"Cleverness should hunt always beside strength, Hound of Eothas."
"This defiance will be your last!"
You tear the control panel from the machine and toss the apparatus to the ground. Sparks fly, thick smoke billows, and the humming stutters to a stop. The machine's rings tumble to the floor.
You tear the control panel from the machine and toss the apparatus to the ground. Sparks fly, thick smoke billows, and the humming stutters to a stop. The machine's rings tumble to the floor.
"NO!" The god Galawain cries out, but he cannot stop you.
"You would do well to think twice before crossing me."
Moments later, you're nearly thrown to the floor as a roar from out of nightmares shakes the ruins.
